intro: Psydrax manensis, commonly known as the African waterleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often heart-shaped or ovate. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typically found in axillary positions. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that splits open to release seeds. Psydrax manensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
